_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary



Facility: Golden Furrow Fertilizer, Inc. North English, IA 52316

Contact: Jeff Miller

Phone: 319-330-1391



1. Facility Policy.



   The owners, management and employees of Golden Furrow Fertilizer, Inc. are committed to the

prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the

facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Keokuk Co. LEPC, and/or other authorities, to

mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.



2. Facility Information.

   

   The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers. The fertilizer product,

anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop

production. Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.



3. The Worst-Case Release Scenario and the Alternate Release Scenario



   An analysis of the potential off-site consequences of hypothetical worst-case and alternative-case accidental

releases have been addressed in our Hazard Assessment and information is in our Risk Management

Program.



4. Accidental Release Prevention Program



   The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health

Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia" and our state

regulations covering anhydrous ammonia. The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form;

see Section 8.3 (b).



5. Five-Year Accident History.

   

   There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused

any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has there been any

accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental

damage.



6. Emergency Action Plan.



   The facility has:



   a. A written emerg

ency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard

      29 CFR 1910.38;



   b. Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and

      Community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA);



   c. If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility,

the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and

call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our

Emergency Action Plan.



7. Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

   

   Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess

the conditions at Golden Furrow Fertilizer, Inc. There are no additional specific safety recommendations

regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
